sentence.Network_en: Hothouse plants do not possess exuberant vitality.
sentence.Network_cn: 在温室里培养出来的东西,不会有强大的生命力.

sentence.Network_en: I used to keep them alive -- in a small hothouse. "
sentence.Network_cn: 我养活它们, 养在小温室里. ”

entry.def: A hothouse is a heated building, usually made of glass, in which plants and flowers can be grown.

entry.tran: （尤指思想或感情活动的）爆发地，温床
entry.def: You can refer to a situation or place as a hothouse when there is intense activity, especially intellectual or emotional activity.

example.ex: The vast crowds make Rome a frantic hothouse at times.
example.tran: 熙攘的人群有时将罗马变成一个癫狂情绪的爆发地。

example.ex: ...the reputation of the College as a hothouse of novel ideas.
example.tran: 该学院享有的新思想摇篮的美誉

means.word_mean: 1. a greenhouse in which plants are arranged in a pleasing manner
